p: In comparing the frequency of decoupling between CO2 emissions and ecological footprint from real income, we can conclude that CO2 emissions decouple from real income more often. In 22 of 27 periods, Australia’s CO2 emissions decoupled from real income, whereas ecological footprint decoupled from real income only 18 times. Together with this, when the graphed trends are compared, an upward trend is observed in CO2 emissions and real income decoupling, which is a desirable result. Figure 9 illustrates a constant trend in ecological footprint and real income decoupling. Overall, we can conclude that real income was a more dominant influence on ecological footprint.
